topic.title: 1+Gallery not keeping files
topic.body: I've a few galleries pinned but the (pre) loaded images are removed after some time. Am i missing something? What must i do keep (and seed) those images?

1567156332_1BDuQk2j7RCQKqK4xyPzNLsrNDH6k.body:
> [quac](#comment_4_1LPWDoyPyLywNDWafMdS7EU7vKUUHzdJ61): How can I run a Minecraft server?

you need to start it

1578503863_1KeQgkJqDQPQWS6dT523QhtX8XoEi.body:
> [robione](#comment_384_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): it helps to give the link

So each gallery repo is different?
I'm (only) using 1+Gallery ( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PGaLLNiadMzrmw6MMMnpZnskwFcdgZoS4/?!/ ). 
You can try http://127.0.0.1:43110/16cYTZiW45hZ1tQCVVth5ZVqNe2ZZAWUFk

> [mg0](#comment_210_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): Make sure the optional files limit isn't surpassed in ZeroHello files tab, I remember this being the reason some of the images in my galleries where being deleted, but can't recall if I had them pinned or not.

Thanks!
I was at 111% so i guess this might be the reason. I'll see if increasing this helps.

1587891915_184rhnxM89SU1gDuPEaQPjynfytkR.body: I've recently played Quake (quakespasm) on an ARM board using the open source panfrost gpu driver. I wonder if it can handle such a game, too.

Just tried Xonotic on my ARM with panfrost, works fine, too.
(Beside being rather slow compared to anything closer to a gaming rig)
